FAQs about Sarah Clarke

Who is Sarah Clarke?

She is an American actress renowned for her role as Nina Myers on the TV series 24, and for playing Renée Dwyer, Bella Swan’s mother, in the Twilight film series.

How did she start her acting career?

She began acting after studying abroad in Italy during her senior year of college. Upon returning, she started studying architectural photography and received free acting lessons in exchange for taking photos at a cultural arts center.

What are some notable roles played by Clarke?

Besides her famous roles in 24 and Twilight, she has appeared in the TV shows Covert Affairs and Bosch, and films like Thirteen and The Lather Effect.

Has she won any awards for her acting?

Yes, she received the Golden Satellite Award for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Drama Series for her work in 24.

Is Sarah Clarke married?

Yes, she is married to actor Xander Berkeley, whom she met on the set of 24. They married in 2002 and have two daughters.

What education did she have?

She attended Indiana University where she studied Fine Arts and Italian. She also took acting classes at Circle in the Square Theatre School, among other institutions.

What was Clarke’s first acting role?

Her first acting role was in a 1999 commercial for Volkswagen, which was followed by a role in the short film Pas de deux.

Did she work in any other professions before acting?

Yes, she was initially involved in architectural photography before fully pursuing a career in acting.

What was Clarke’s breakout role?

Her breakout role was as Nina Myers on the TV series 24, which significantly raised her profile in the acting community.

Has she appeared in any theater productions?

Yes, she has appeared in theater productions including the 24 Hour Plays.

What are some recent projects of Clarke?

She starred in Bosch, an Amazon Studios police procedural drama, where she played Eleanor Wish.
